properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 10:20PM MST until January 11 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 1
to 3 inches at lower elevations and 2 to 5 inches at higher
elevations. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph resulting in
localized blizzard or near-blizzard conditions with blowing
snow through the passes, especially Monida Pass, Raynolds Hill,
Targhee Pass, Norris Hill, Big Hole Pass, and Chief Joseph Pass.

* WHERE...Beaverhead, Madison and Gallatin.

* WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Widespread blowing snow and strong winds will result
in near-whiteout conditions at times in exposed locations and
through the higher passes. Plan on slippery road conditions.
Increased avalanche danger is also possible.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on
young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local
Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY
